intro: Epilobium pseudovirgatum, commonly known as the purple willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often boggy habitats. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are elliptical and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often reddish in color. Epilobium pseudovirgatum is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies.
